inn1.comm: full and middle and leg, touch of swing, Cook flicks it to square leg
more swing but this time it starts outside leg and slips down the leg side
back of a length, on off stump, defended towards mid-on
there's the first yorker, on target as well around off stump, it squirts off the outside edge behind point
on a length at middle and off, Bell gets across his crease and defends to the leg side
hint of width and that's nicely cut away squad through point for the first boundary
on a length, outside off, left alone
on off stump, defended to the covers
touch fuller this time, on middle and off, blocked back down the pitch
gets forward on off stump, defended square into the off side

dropped, but it would have been a terrific catch from Dilshan. Cook reaching out in front of his body and drives in the air off a thick outside edge. Dilshan dived high to his left but couldn't hold on
takes the thigh pad into the leg side
touch of seam movement this time from short of a length, squares up Cook a touch and it runs into the off side...good first over from Kulasekara
full outside off, Bell gets onto the front foot and drives to mid-off
not quite so full this time, Bell opens the face a touch as he plays into the off side
back of a length, Bell opens the face and runs it down to third man
loses his line onto leg stump and it's neatly clipped away off the pads down to fine leg
back on off stump, driven into cover
good delivery to finish with, on off stump, touch of swing back into Cook who defends to the bowler
on a length outside off, chopped down to third man
outside off, Cook pulls his bat inside the line
defended towards mid-off
fuller and a touch wider, he gets a big stride forward and drives to the right of mid-off but not quite with the best of timing...easy single
this whistles away through the covers, Bell leans into a drive against a wide-ish delivery, driving on the up and his bottom hand come off the bat...ball went all along the ground
tighter to off stump, defended firmly towards the bowler who gets a hand on it
starts on the pads, flicked wide of square leg
adjusts his line a fraction, on middle and off, defended towards mid-on
nice piece of placement from Cook, stands tall and drives a short-of-a-length delivery between point and cover over the wide square of pitches
a strangled appeal for lbw, nips back off a length but took Cook very high on the pads
across onto off stump, defended
short of a length, whipped off the back foot just wide enough of mid-on for a comfortable single
full outside off, defended into the covers

first breakthrough! Went after a wide delivery, he moved across his crease to try and reach it, well away from his body and thin edge through to Sangakkara. He hadn't been offered much width and his eyes lit up
edgy start, a full delivery on middle, Ballance plays across his pad a little and gets a thick inside edge into the leg side
short of a length outside off, cut down to third man
full on off stump, defended to the covers
a little fuller, brings Ballance forward into a drive. It went in the air for a short while before reaching mid-off
a flamboyant drive from Bell and he gets beaten on the outside edge. It wasn't that full and he was playing it on the up, but the swing took it past the edge
a tighter stroke this time, stays on the back foot and pushes into the off side
on off stump, punched square into the covers
gets onto the front foot and drives firmly into the covers but can't beat the off-side ring
dropped in short and Bell takes advantage, pull it wide of midwicket and although it wasn't perfectly timed it skipped away
full and wide, driven to cover
keeping it full, as he must do and his pace, Ballance pushes towards mid-off
that's a nice piece of timing, flicks it away from middle and stump and it's towards the shorter of the boundaries so fine leg can't stop it
lunges forward and defends to point
the ball just holding a fraction in the surface, nearly takes a leading edge as Ballance closes his face
that's a terrific shot, a punchy straight drive which beats the bowler in his follow through and splits mid-off and mid-on
pushes this outside off, left alone
back of a length, driven on the up to mid-off
works a straight delivery off his pads behind square on the leg side
tucked into the leg side
back of a length on off stump, runs off an open face and backward point prevents the single
a similar shot and it runs finer this time down to third man
defended back to the bowler
full on off stump, bat and pad together as he defends
a loose drive this time, quite similar to Cook's dismissal but no edge from Ballance...his foot wasn't to the pitch, playing away from his body
short of a length, nips back into Ballance who guides it, on the bounce, towards slip
fuller again, pushed up to mid-on
touch width, cuts to backward point
this one scoots off a thick outside edge as Ballance drives, it was in the air but goes fine of backward point to third man
worked away from off stump into the leg side with a flick of the wrists
out with a hit! Bell tucked the ball into square leg and immediately thought there was two, but Sangakkara chased it very hard from behind the stumps and a direct hit would have had Bell short
run down to third man
push and run towards mid-off
comes forward and drives straight down the ground, no great power behind the shot so mid-on is able to get around
back of a length outside off, opens the face down to third man
starts very full, hint of swing into Ballance who jabs down
gets forward into a more confident drive this time, picks out mid-off
gets outside leg stump this time and very neatly worked away fine of long leg
keeping it full at the stumps, dug out into midwicket
outside off, not so full, Bell forward and pushes to cover
banged in a short, a rare short ball from Malinga, looped off the slow surface and Bell held back in his pull long enough to help the ball into midwicket
on a length outside off, 76mph, driven to the covers
lovely delivery, nipped away off the seam to beat the outside edge as he came forward
width this time, Bell drives square but there's a sweeper out on the cover boundary now
ah, that's some of Bell at his best...a beautiful lofted straight drive against a full delivery, his intent was always to clear the boundary. Lovely long follow through.
opens the face and plays to point
this goes in the air a long way towards third man as Bell upper-cuts at some width but it doesn't have the legs to carry to Malinga
chopped down to third man
touch of extra bounce from a good length seems to take Ballance by surprise but he's able to guide to third man
drifts onto leg stump, clipped out to deep square-leg who is quickly into the ball to prevent a second
good diving save at backward point by Dilshan as Ballance cuts
touch of width again but no timing or placement from Ballance as he cuts it into the ground towards cover
good work again by Dilshan, he's being kept busying. Springing to his right this time to intercept a better timed cut
top shot from Bell, driven on the up wide of mid-off, but it's an excellent chase from Lakmal who then dives near the rope to flick the ball back
forward on off stump, runs off the face to third man
nicely bowled, back of a length and nips back into Bell but it's able to jab it backward of point
cut down to third man
ah, well bowled...nice shape away from Bell and he's beaten as he tries to glide it to third man
full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
short and pulled wide of deep midwicket so they can run hard for the second, brings the fifty partnership up
fuller and straight line, flicks the pad to long leg and they get an extra
Bell takes a walk down the wicket, the bowler tries to cramp him up but fires it down the leg side
back of a length, Bell up on his toes to dab into midwicket for an easy single
cut off a thick top edge and it flies over slip's right shoulder and whistles to the rope, too tight a line for the cut, it wasn't a chance to the second slip
fuller, played gently out to deep cover for an easy single
full at the stumps, tucked through midwicket for another easy single
full of a length two feet wide of off stump, a pleasant drive to deep cover
same stroke from the left-hander to a similar ball
tighter line, dabbed into the covers but no single available
touch shorter and Bell late cuts wide of third man for two
touch too full and Bell whacks it down the ground for a one-bounce four, lovely timing, well away from mid-off, glorious clean strike
shorter and tighter line, clipped behind deep-square leg and they come back for a second
around the wicket, full length on the stumps, flicked back to the bowler
similar delivery but this time Ballance works it into the leg side for a single
over the wicket to Bell, full outside off, driven through cover to the sweeper
more flight and Ballance gets an inside edge through midwicket having looked to play off side initially
Bell went back but it was full and he ended up tapping it back to the bowler
similar scenario with Bell back on his stumps to a ball that's quite full and he just knocks it up the wicket again
slower ball a foot wide of off stump, reached out for and ran to point
another slower ball, Ballance slightly deceived and chips it into the covers, safely enough but he popped it up
length ball a foot wide of off stump, Bell tries to run it down to third man but can only find backward point
cutter around off stump, worked from the crease to midwicket, no run available
this time Bell works a fuller ball wide of midwicket and they get a single this time
length on the stumps, a little straight worked out to long leg
carefully forward on off stump and ran to backward point
premeditated paddle sweep from just outside off, gets it fine enough for a couple
slightly fuller length, driven firmly to point and there's a fumble so they get a single to bring the hundred up
premeditated reverse paddle but straight to the short third man
straighter line, flicked to short long leg, no run available
length, waited for and punched down the ground to bring up a smart fifty from Bell in 52 balls

big cry for lbw as Bell slightly falls over himself looking to play to leg, was hit low on the pad, looked to be sliding down, not out given but they go for the review and Hawk Eye has it only just clipping leg stump so that goes down as a bit of a waste of a review really
cutter and Bell is almost deceived coming forward and gets a bit of a leading edge into the covers, not aerial
fuller length and Bell plays a flourishing drive that goes directly to extra cover

another slower ball, Bell sits back for it and swings leg side but swings it straight to short long leg where Malinga takes an easy catch. A poor dismissal from Bell's point of view not getting the elevation on a ball that was there to hit but he picked it up only as far as Malinga who only had his hat falling off to worry about in taking the catch
wide delivery, short enough to cut down to third man
wide line again, fuller, and Ballance lets it go
paddle sweep from off stump, gets it very fine and they pick up a couple

forward, then back, goes to cut and chops it on it was a ball flicked out of the front of the hand, went on with the angle from around the wicket and Morgan, rocking back to cut, has slashed it onto his middle stump and his promotion has failed. Probably too full a length to cut
tossed up onto a full length outside off, Root digs it back to the bowler
tighter line so Root works it down to long-on
around the wicket, full just outside off, tucked out to deep cover
back across the stumps but tucking straight to midwicket
back of a length just outside off, forced to backward point
fuller and straighter, tucked up on the leg side from the crease
much wider line outside off, full enough for Ballance to reach out to try and drive, not much of a connection but lifts it wide of deep cover
length ball a foot outside off, dabbed down to third man
uses the angle across the left-hander to guide to third man, not wide enough of the fielder for a second
full on off stump, Root plays to point from the crease
back of a length, flicked out to deep midwicket
floated up, gets some drift in, Root drives to extra cover
full and straight, ran back to the bowler
drifting into the pads so Root can work out to deep midwicket
full length on the stumps, flicked out to long-on
forward and flicking towards midwicket who gets across well to his left and saves a single, nice work
back of a length, forced off the back foot wide of deep midwicket so they get a second run
another punching stroke to the leg side, into another gap allowing two runs comfortably
fuller length, waited for in the crease and slapped to backward point
a cutter that has Ballance rather groping outside his ground and he drives and misses outside off stump
tight off stump line on a good length, Ballance drops it towards point
little bit more room to work with outside off, slapped hard but not past the off side sweeper
pushed into midwicket
on leg stump, shovelled into the leg side some excellent placement and running makes it a brace
chopped into the off side and that takes Ballance to a well-constructed fifty
some turn into Root who plays it off the back foot to cover
goes for the reverse sweep, it spins past his legs and rebounds off Sangakkara to short fine-leg
flicked along the ground through midwicket and the Yorkshire pair scamper between the wickets
on a length at off stump, pushed into the covers
that's all the way over a long boundary...drops this a fraction short, gives Ballance the chance to swing through the line and he pulls it handsomely over deep square-leg
goes full this time, dug out to the office
swung into the leg side again, similar length delivery but couldn't quite get underneath it this time and the connection isn't as clean
full outside off, steered into the covers with an open face...Dilshan diving around again as he has done for much of today
does well to make a boundary out of this, very full outside off and he jabs it fine of third man...short boundary towards the dressing rooms
worked down the ground to long-on
fetched from outside off and slog-swept through midwicket
tossed up full and again pushed down the ground
goes for another slog sweep but this time doesn't make contact, not far from taking his off stump
goes into the back foot and nudges out to deep midwicket
another reverse sweep but only gains him a single to short third man
starts on a length outside off, driven firmly to point
pushed outside leg stump, flicked off the pads to deep square
another slower ball outside off, 70mph, and he opens the face to third man
full and straight, keeps rolling his fingers over the ball, it's run down to third man and Root hurtles himself back for a second run...he dives, but was safe
full toss down the leg side but Root gets a leading edge which loops towards mid-on...he's annoyed with himself, just closed the face of the bat
a little too much on the pads but it's only a single as Root works out to deep square
dragged down a little short, Root pulls and it goes off more top edge than middle and loops into the leg side short of deep midwicket

not enough distance this time! Ballance tried to heave this from outside off over one of the long boundaries, but it came off the bottom of the bat and Chandimal had plenty of time to steady under the catch at deep midwicket
lapped around the corner towards short fine-leg
beaten by the doosra as this spins away from Bopara
stays on leg stump and places this square through the off side
flicked from off stump to midwicket
full on off stump, defended
runs this down to third man
good from Lakmal, full on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
a fraction short this time, it's pulled but only for a single to deep square
full with a hint of swing, driven firmly and just to the left of mid-off
something more agricultural from Root as he clubs a length delivery but picks out mid-on
swept from outside off so it goes quite square...there's a fumble at deep square but it doesn't cost anything

and that's gone as well! Went for the sweep and it struck him on the back leg. Only thing would have been outside the line and replays say it was! So a review would have saved Bopara, but he declined to use it.
plays him off the back foot, pushed to midwicket
worked square into the leg side to get off the mark
sweep is his favoured route again, finds deep square
pushed back to the bowler
and he's been put into the stands! Root goes deep in his crease, Malinga is short of yorker length and Root is able to get underneath it to loft over long-on
full at the stumps, steered into the off side
ooh, nearly done by the slower-ball. It dipped late on Buttler but he was just able to get the bottom of the bat on the ball
full and wide outside, and a misfield! England gifted a boundary. Buttler drove it towards deep cover, it skipped over the wide square and deep cover dived over the top of it
jabbed into the off side, this time the sweeper is safely behind it
aims to flick this through the leg side, the late swing means it comes off a leading edge but along the ground to mid-off
full and straight, flicked with plenty of bottom hand down to long-on
slower ball on off stump, 62mph, and it slides off the face to short third man
he goes dead-eye straight down the ground, a lofted straight drive to a length delivery, but not the power to beat long-on
low full toss, drilled back at the bowler and it ricochets off his shin into the midwicket area
clever batting from Root, he picks the slower ball (which drifted onto leg stump) and the gap in the field as he went down on one knee and swept to deep square-leg
plenty of invention here, Root goes for a stood-up reverse sweep and gets bottom edge into his pad which bobbles close to the stumps
full outside off, a powerful drive to the cover sweeper who can't prevent a second
reaches for this wide outside off, lofts it over backward point wide of third man
can't get this yorker away, comes off the toe of the bat back to Malinga
speared wide outside off
another big wide outside off, Malinga not at his best
gets it straight this time but it's a low full toss at off stump, driven sweetly through the off side and wide of the cover sweeper...these two both very quick between the wickets
can't get this one away
beaten to finish the over as he tries to drive through the off side
poor delivery, big full toss and Root gets down on one knee to scoop it over short fine leg
full and straight, flicked through midwicket...more good running
this time he's gone, goes down on on knee to sweep a back-of-the-hand slower ball and is taken on the knee roll. Having not advised Bopara to review he uses it himself but it's three reds
thick edge and useful for England, Jordan forcing hard at his first ball and it flies wide of Sangakkara
another edge! But this it goes once bounce straight to Sangakkara
top, top shot from Jordan...we've seen before how well he can bat. This is an on-the-up drive to a length ball. A No. 3 or 4 would have been proud of that drive and he races to the long-off boundary
full and wide, drilled towards cover where Jayawardene makes a good diving save
slower ball, full and straight, Jordan keeps his eyes on it, takes an outside edge to third man
drives out to deep cover with a fierce flick of the wrists to try and get as much power as he can
plenty of power again from Jordan and is drives, without a follow through this time, out to deep cover
sprayed very wide outside off, Buttler started to move around his crease and that may have forced the error
again he's shuffling around his crease, then lofts a drive over cover - Malinga missing his yorker - and placed it between long-off and the cover sweeper
that's an excellent yorker and Buttler is only able to squeeze it off the edge to third man but it means he keeps the strike
he middles this, using his feet to drive, but couldn't have picked out extra cover any better
he shows how it's done, Kulasekara offering up a length delivery which he drives over the cover fielders
and this one is into the strands! He strikes a clean ball. Poor length, again, and this one is driven high and mighty into the stands over long-off. Beautiful straight bat
that's better, speared in at leg stump but they still manage a couple as Jordan forces it down to long-on
driven straight again but long-off is back...still, though, another two thanks to Buttler's sprinting
cracking shot, this is a gem of an innings from Jordan. Low full toss and it punches it sweetly straight down the ground
slower ball, Buttler gets a bottom edge as he aims a swing over the leg side...Sangakkara collects but Jordan was running whatever happened and made the crease
gives himself room to leg, Malinga keeps it full outside off, Jordan doesn't make contact but they scamper a bye...Sangakkara not getting on the ten-pin bowling team at the moment

that's huge! Now it's Buttler's turn. He doesn't want to be forgotten. Short of yorker length, Buttler stands still, deep in his crease and crunches it into the second tier of the stand behind long-on
low full toss outside off, slapped into the covers
now he gets the benefit of an inside edge past the stumps which beats short fine-leg...the luck of the brace for Jordan
and he finishes it with six over long-off! My goodness. Jordan swings through the line of a length delivery and is almost starting his walk off the ground as this lands in the spectators

inn2.comm: good length around off stump, blocked in the crease
fuller length and Thirimanne is forward to play into the covers
shorter ball on a tight line, it moves in a little as the batsman leaves alone, struck too high on the pad for an lbw shout
this darts away from the left-hander but it was wide enough for him not to offer a stroke

this now swings back in, much fuller, and beats the inside edge, huge cry for lbw and given out lbw it looked pretty good but Thirimanne reviews. He definitely hasn't hit it, is it too high? No. Hawk Eye has it taking a huge chunk of the bails and Sri Lanka lose an opener and a review. Classic Anderson, full and swinging and did for Thirimanne used to playing in Bangladesh recently
full and swings away a little, Sangakkara right out to meet it and blocks into the covers
length wide delivery and Dilshan has a huge swipe at it and misses completely, it was a wide loosener
much tighter line, swings in a little, Dilshan forward, playing out towards square leg and gets a single
back of a length, it bounces a little and hits Sangakkara high on the bat, he manages to drop it down safely enough
slides down the leg side and Buttler gets across to block it
back of a length, a hint of width and angled to backward point
tighter line again and gets blocked up the wicket from the crease
hint of width again and this time Sangakkara finds the gap in front of point, lovely timing, hit on top of the bounce
finds his line again and just blocked in the crease once more
full on off stump, firmly driven back to the bowler where Anderson saves with his left hand
touch wider of off stump and Dilshan lashes at it and gets it to cover
shorter, darts back into the body and runs away to point
back fuller, too straight, and Dilshan whips it past midwicket with decent timing
full length on off stump, forward and dropped into the covers, they take on Bopara and get home just about
little overpitched again and Sangakkara drives through the line and times it nicely inside mid-on
full length on the stumps, Dilshan forward and playing back to the bowler, more difficult to whip that angle through midwicket
beauty, it bounces and nips away from Dilshan poking from the crease, beaten outside off
drops the length back, strikes the thigh pad of Dilshan
full length, clipped to square leg
fourth-stump line, driven without timing to mid-off
short and pulled down to long leg for a single
good length on off stump, Dilshan dabs it down just wide enough of mid-off for a quick single
decent length on off stump, played half-forward and blocked up the wicket
good line and length again, just blocked in the crease
similar delivery, similarly played
not much Sangakkara can do with this either, dabbed up on the on side
tight line again from Anderson, just blocked in the crease once more
good length just outside off, played out to point
straighter line and a touch fuller, clipped down to long leg

full of length just outside off, Sangakkara pokes forward at it and drags it into his stumps and the pressure works for England. Poor stroke here, no foot movement at all from Sanakkara just looking to play it out on the off side, it shaped in a little and took a thick inside edge smack into middle and leg stumps
decent length just outside off, blocked from the crease
full on the stumps, dabbled behind square leg and Jayawardene is away
length ball dropped into midwicket and they scamper a quick single
full on the off stump, Dilshan forward playing off an inside edge to midwicket
back of a length, Dilshan goes to pull and is far too late on the stroke, getting a top edge off high on the bat but fortunately for him it flies over the slip cordon to fine third man
here's a collectors item, Dilshan leaves this alone outside off, good length ball two feet wide of the stumps
wider line and there's no leaving this, Dilshan cuts off the toe but enough bat to get it past cover point
another one for the collectors, Dilshan this time shoulders arms outside off!
back to an off stump line, Dilshan pushes it firmly back to the bowler
goes to leave this but was too late in doing so and got plenty of bat on it down to third man
firm drive to a length ball on middle and off, gets a thick inside edge down to long leg
across the off stump to block a full bal into extra cover
fourth-stump line, blocked on the front foot
full length sliding across the right-hander who felt for it and got beaten
tighter line and driven but only as far as mid-off
forward on off stump blocked up the wicket
able to fashion this towards point who scrambles across and just parries so they can get a single
shorter length, helped around the corner and gets a single to long leg
firm drive off a length to mid-off
flashing blade off the back foot, gets a thick outside edge that flies where a third slip would have been down to third man who does well to save two
tighter line, dabbed with the angle to square leg for a run
loosener that drifts down the leg side
tighter line but Jayawardene able to use the angle to play to long leg
back of a length and wide enough to cut, good connection from Dilshan and he gets it wide of third man, well steered
drives at this on the front foot but only as far as cover point
tighter line and played up to mid-on from the crease
Dilshan dabs from the crease into the covers and sets off for a single that Jayawardene was slow to react to, had Morgan hit, Jayawardene was gone
good length at the pads, clipped out to deep square
around the wicket, middle stump line, dabbed to square leg
swept hard and it's well placed behind square
leg stump line, clipped out to deep square leg
tossed up and played firmly down to long-on
swept again, almost squeezes past the stroke, enough bat to get it to short long leg
forward and turning this around the corner in front of short long leg for a quick single
forward on off stump and played back up the wicket
straighter line and clipped down to long leg
good length, played forward and dropped into midwicket
straighter line and this is clipped out to deep square
good length on off stump, Dilshan plays from the crease and forces this to extra cover
width offered and Dilshan slaps is behind point to ruin Jordan's hitherto smart over
full length on the stumps, tickled around the corner and they get a single to short long leg's left
back and slapped hard down to long-on
full and very wide, reached for and steered to point
this is too wide though and left alone
forward on off stump and blocked up the wicket
yorker-length on the stumps, dug out to mid-off
very full again, punched down to mid-off
around the wicket, back to pull and gets a bottom edge into the pads as it skidded on a little
fuller length, clipped to midwicket
bit of width, cut hard but straight to cover point
length delivery clipped out to deep midwicket
just outside leg stump, swept fine but not fine enough to get past the deep square fielder running to his right
reverse swept but straight to short third man

full ball a foot outside off, Dilshan throws the kitchen sink at it having taken a few steps down the wicket and got a whirl of an outside edge to third man where Ballance holds a smart catch just in from the rope. A wild swipe from Dilshan, no control on that and perishes in the deep
slip goes in, bumper first up, Mathews gets under it
full at the stumps, clipped to mid-on
short again, pulled from outside off and misses completely
back of a length slides down leg
back of a length, dabbed into midwicket and they get an easy single
full on the middle and off stumps, worked to midwicket
around the the wicket, clipped inside midwicket and they steal a quick single
reverse sweep in the air but picks out the gap wide of backward point and this skips away for four
a shimmy down the track and careful chip into the outfield wide of long-on for an easy two
back on his stumps and angling to short third man, no chance of a single
gives himself a little room and plays in-to-out, driving with perfect timing wide of long-off this time, almost carries for six
leg stump line, tucked in front of the leg side 45 for an easy run
floaty full ball on off stump, firmly punched to extra cover
opens the body up to play square to backward point, Mathews wanted a single that was never there
floaty ball again that ends up as a full toss outside off, Jayawardene swings at it and misses and Buttler misses it completely
back of a length and Jayawardene gets across his stumps and flicks it behind square on the leg side, just helped around the corner to the short boundary
slower just outside off, played on the front foot to point
full just outside off, driven down to long-off
over the wicket, flicked through the leg side to deep square
touch shorter, driven off the back foot into the covers where Bopara dives and parries the ball

massive wicket! He tries to flick this through midwicket again but this time can't keep the ball down and picks out Eoin Morgan. Perhaps played a fraction early. The change of line worked. Another example of Tredwell's calmness and cool thinking under pressure
nicely bowled, flighted outside off and it turns a little, beats Chandimal's flick and takes the pad
worked along the ground through midwicket
a lone appeal from the bowler as the batsman reverse sweeps, struck outside off, the ball dribbles to short third man
flash and miss outside off, and it's called wide...a tad harsh, maybe
pushed down the ground to long-off
connects well with this one, slog sweeps from outside off along the ground through midwicket
back-of-the-hand slower ball, full at the toes, nudged into the leg side
another loopy slower ball, 61mph, outside off, Mathews almost swings himself off his feet and still doesn't connect
opens the face square into the off side
driven to deep cover
sweeps a length delivery to deep square
a little flatter, played to midwicket
puts away a low full toss with a very strong reverse sweep...bit of freebie, but still expertly played
worked through midwicket and there's a very swift bit of running
steps towards leg, almost done for a lack of pace as Tredwell holds it back. Mathews well through his stroke and miscues to the leg side
flicked to deep square
starts short and wide, it zings off the middle of that new bat out to deep cover as he drives off the back foot
that was a sharp bouncer, and well directed over the shoulder. Chandimal plays the hook but is beaten. High take from Buttler.
he edges this one! Short of a length, Chandimal heaves across the line aiming for the leg side boundary but just gets a thin top edge
back of a length, defended
short outside off, beats the top edge with some extra bounce as he goes to cut

and another...it's falling away for Sri Lanka. The shorter delivery works again. Back of a length, Kulasekara heaves to the leg side and gets a massive top edge which goes straight up, giving Buttler plenty of time to trot around and take his second catch of the over
steps to leg, a slightly short delivery is cut to short third man
uses his feet and drives down to long-on
round the wicket, on the stumps, patted through midwicket
another reverse sweep proves profitable, this one hit over the head of backward point
flicked to midwicket

he can't get three reverse sweeps away, though! Terrific catch by Cook. It looped off the top edge, he got too far underneath it this time, but Cook still had to run backwards a fair distance from short third man and took a well-judged catch coming over his shoulder
another short one, not convincingly played as he goes for the pull and is cramped for room
quick and short, fended away off the glove backward of square...hostile stuff from Jordan
dropped, Gurney couldn't quite take a tough chance a third man. Perera gave himself room to a short delivery and carved down towards the boundary, Gurney was running in but couldn't hold on low down
fuller outside off, guided past slip to third man
he keeps giving it to Perera, short outside leg stump, following the left hander as he moves away from the stumps and it flies through to Buttler
now he tries to hit the stumps with the fuller one, he isn't far away either as Perera gives him a full view of all three
pushed down the ground to long-on
another neat catch, this time Root at long-on. Perera swinging like a rusty gate, it was a length delivery, and he picked out the deep fielder with pretty good accuracy
blocked to the off side
comes down the pitch, carves this over the off side and just gets enough on it to clear cover running from inside the circle
uses his feet again, lofts it straighter this time, Root makes good ground around the rope to cut off the boundary
dragged down a little short, pulled to deep midwicket
short of a length, climbs past the outside edge as Malinga spars away from his body
keeps it short, Malinga not keen to get in line and drops his hands
pulls his bat inside the line
goes for the fuller ball and Malinga responds by smearing it over mid-off and it dribbles into the rope
back to the short stuff after that boundary, targetting the body with a leg-stump line, and Malinga certainly isn't keeping his eyes on the ball
nearly bowls him...Malinga goes well outside off stump, it's a length delivery, he misses his swing but the ball carries over the timber
driven firmly back and well fielded, diving to his left, by Bopara
short and angled into the pads, pulled backward of square and despite getting to the ball Anderson can't flick the ball back
a full slower ball outside off, lofted into the off side and falls into space
driven to deep cover
dropped in his followthrough, it was hammered back by Malinga and caught Bopara by surprise, although he did have his eyes on it. Good test for a dodgy finger
takes the pad as he swings to leg
round the wicket, slower ball outside off, beats the outside edge
lets himself down a little by overstepping, gets clubbed into midwicket
and he's overstepped again! This is careless. Takes a thick inside edge down to fine leg
that's a good delivery, full outside off, beats the edge
picks out long-on...Senanayake tried to send this length delivery into the stands but it didn't come out of the middle and it was a simple catch
full at the stumps, defended
full outside off, powerfully driven past cover and wide of mid-off but Jordan is able to chase it down
heaved down the ground to long-on
slower ball, drifts into the batsman, takes a thick inside edge to the leg side
misses his swing to leg, takes the pad
missed stumping to add to Buttler's list...Malinga head in the air, swinging to leg, and he should really have taken that
strikes the back as he goes to pull, the ball scoots through
all over! The slower ball does the trick. Malinga giving himself room outside leg stump and misses his wild swing
